newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Ares-Serono sales up in most regions.
newsitem.headline: Ares-Serono sales up in most regions.

text.p: Ares-Serono Group said a 17.4 percent rise in 1996 European sales was due mainly to a strong performance by its Metrodin follicle stimulating hormone and the successful launch of its Gonal-F product in 10 European countries.
Ares-Serono reported an 18 percent rise in 1996 worldwide sales to $805 million. European sales were up 17.4 percent to $384.4 million.
It said sales in the U.K. were up 60 percent, sales in Nordic countries rose by 57 percent, Benelux sales rose 35 percent and sales in Germany advanced by 31 percent.
Sales in North America exceeded $200 million for the first time ever, amounting to $215.6 million as compared to $176.8 million in 1995.
Sales rose by 46 percent in the Asia Pacific region, 31 percent in Oceania and 14 percent in Latin America.

But Japan sales declined by 14 percent due to negative currency fluctuations and lower selling prices as of the second quarter. Excluding the currency impact, sales in Japan were virtually flat, Ares-Serono also said. -- Zurich Editorial +41 1 631 7340
